snippet: After William C. Thompson Jr. exited the mayoral race, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and other Democratic leaders rallied around Bill de Blasio, who faced attacks from his Republican rival, Joseph J. Lhota.
abstract: William C Thompson Jr concedes Democratic mayoral primary to Bill de Blasio on steps of New York City Hall; state's Democratic leaders, including Gov Andrew M Cuomo, hold coronation of sorts, praising de Blasio as bold new messenger for party.

byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM and THOMAS KAPLAN
byline.contributor: Al Baker, Michael Barbaro and David W. Chen contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: After William C. Thompson Jr. exited the mayoral race, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and other Democratic leaders rallied around Bill de Blasio, who faced attacks from his Republican rival, Joseph J. Lhota.

headline.main: A Display of Democratic Unity as Thompson Cedes to de Blasio
headline.print_headline: A Display of Democratic Unity as Thompson Cedes to de Blasio
